Prohibition of Employment Practices Involving Genetic Information. Employers are prohibited from acquiring, using, or requiring genetic information or testing of employees or applicants for employment for discriminatory purposes related to employment opportunities and conditions. Employers are prohibited from acquiring, using, or requiring genetic information or testing of employees for discriminatory purposes related to employment opportunities and conditions. It is unlawful for an employer to disclose genetic information of employees to unauthorized individuals or to maintain access to such information unless necessary for job-related purposes or required by law. Employers are prohibited from accessing an employee's genetic information without their prior written consent.
